column6: Nomination and selection of the highest governance body
column13: The Nomination and Governance Committee oversees succession planning for the Board, its committees, the CEO, and the Board Chair. The Committee recommends to the Board candidates it considers appropriate for appointment and oversees the evaluation of prospective candidates. It ensures appropriate checks are undertaken, such as character, experience, education, criminal record, and bankruptcy checks, using an external firm as required.

column6: Nomination and selection of the highest governance body
column13: Directors participate in a comprehensive induction program when they join the Board, tailored to their background, experience, and the Committee positions they will hold. South32's standard induction program typically includes briefings from management on the organisation and specific business areas, significant business imperatives and projects, material litigation and disputes, prevailing market and economic conditions and outlook, and the legal and regulatory environment where South32 operates.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in overseeing the management of impacts
column13: The Board oversees South32's strategy development and implementation, including alignment with its purpose and values, and recognises the importance of considering strategy through an informed view of societal trends and values. In April 2023, the Board participated in a dedicated Strategy Day led by South32's CEO, which allowed the Board to collaborate with management on South32's strategy and vision for the future.

column6: Delegation of responsibility for managing impacts
column13: South32's Board has adopted a Board Charter outlining its role and responsibilities. The Board Charter describes the matters reserved for the Board and those delegated to the Chief Executive Officer (CEO), including authority for the day-to-day management of the South32 Group. The CEO, in turn, delegates certain authorities and responsibilities to management but remains accountable to the Board for the Group's performance and all delegated authority.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in sustainability reporting
column7: The Sustainability Committee oversees South32's approach to managing material sustainability-related risks and opportunities, including climate change. At each meeting, the Committee receives reports from management on climate change progress.

column13: South32 maintains a register of Directors' interests, which its Directors periodically review. Directors must also update the Board with any new information concerning interests or relationships relevant to their independence. Non-Executive Directors may be involved with other companies, associations or professional firms that deal with South32.

Following South32's Independence of Directors Policy, to qualify as independent, a Director must be independent of management and free of any interest, position or other relationship that could materially influence (or be reasonably perceived to influence materially) the exercise of objective, unfettered or independent judgement by the Director or the Director's ability to act in the best interests of the Group or its shareholders generally. All relevant facts and circumstances are considered when making this assessment.

column6: Collective knowledge of the highest governance body
column13: The skills of South32's Directors and the combined capabilities of the Board are evaluated annually. The evaluation results are documented in a Board skills matrix, which is considered by the Nomination and Governance Committee, incorporated into the Board's composition review and succession planning, and informs the focus areas for the Board's continuing education program.

column6: Evaluation of the performance of the highest governance body
column13: The Nomination and Governance Committee oversees the performance evaluation process for the Board, Committees, and individual Directors. An evaluation of at least one of the Board, Committees or individual Directors is undertaken annually and may be internally or externally facilitated.

column7: The Remuneration Committee assists the Board in overseeing the Group's remuneration policy and the remuneration and benefits framework for all South32 employees.

The Board continues to oversee the alignment of South32's remuneration and benefits framework with its purpose, strategy, values, and culture. Since FY22, the LTI component of South32's reward framework has directly linked executive reward to its response to climate change and the transition of its portfolio towards the commodities required for a low-carbon world.
South32's CEO pay ratio in 2023 was 26:1.
